meanings.definition: To coat (a metal, especially aluminum) with a protective oxide layer by electrolysis.
meanings.sent1: The factory will anodize the aluminum sheets for durability.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to anodize aluminum to prevent corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was so well anodized that even lasers couldn't harm it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an anodized shield, protecting her from negativity.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to anodize the metal instantly, leaving the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To subject (a metal) to an electrolytic process in order to form a protective oxide layer.
meanings.sent1: The company will anodize the metal parts before assembly.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers often anodize metals to enhance their longevity.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would anodize the pots to make them indestructible.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to anodize his heart, protecting it from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstroke was like an anodizing process, adding depth to the painting.
